revision.text:
{{EngvarB|date=July 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Jonathan Hogg | image = Jonathan Hogg.jpg | image_size = 150 | caption = | fullname = Jonathan Lee Hogg<ref name="Hugman2010-11">{{Cite book | editor-first = Barry J. | editor-last = Hugman | title = The PFA Footballers' Who's Who 2010–11 | year = 2010 | publisher = Mainstream Publishing | isbn = 978-1-84596-601-0 | page = 199 }}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1988|12|6|df=y}}<ref name="Hugman2010-11"/> | birth_place = [[Middlesbrough]], England | currentclub = [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] | clubnumber = 6 | height = {{height|ft=5|in=7}}<ref name="Hugman2010-11"/> | position = [[Midfielder]] | youthyears1 = 1997–2002 | youthclubs1 = [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] | youthyears2 = 2004–2009 | youthclubs2 = [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] | years1 = 2009–2011 | clubs1 = [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] | caps1 = 6 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2009–2010 | clubs2 = → [[Darlington F.C.|Darlington]] (loan) | caps2 = 5 | goals2 = 1 | years3 = 2011 | clubs3 = → [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]] (loan) | caps3 = 19 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2011–2013 | clubs4 = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] | caps4 = 78 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2013– | clubs5 = [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] | caps5 = 164 | goals5 = 1 | club-update = 09:52, 3 January 2019 (UTC) }} '''Jonathan Lee Hogg''' (born 6 December 1988) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] as a central [[midfielder]]. He previously played for [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] and [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]], and spent periods on loan at [[Darlington F.C.|Darlington]] and [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]].
==Career== ===Aston Villa=== Hogg was born in [[Middlesbrough]], [[North Yorkshire]].<ref name="Hugman2010-11"/> A [[midfielder]], he began his football career as a junior with hometown club [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] before joining [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.birminghammail.net/birmingham-sport/aston-villa-fc/aston-villa-news/2010/10/09/aston-villa-why-stewart-downing-is-providing-motivation-to-reserve-team-player-97319-27434502/ |title=Why Stewart Downing is providing motivation to reserve team player |first=Ken |last=Montgomery |newspaper=Birmingham Mail |date=9 October 2010 |accessdate=25 January 2011}}</ref> His progress was interrupted by a cruciate ligament injury in March 2007,<ref name=AVFCprofile>{{cite web |url=http://www.avfc.co.uk/articles/jonathan-hogg-aston-villa_2235239_48429 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100116105210/http://www.avfc.co.uk/articles/jonathan-hogg-aston-villa_2235239_48429 |archivedate=16 January 2010 |title=Jonathan Hogg |publisher=Aston Villa F.C |accessdate=20 November 2009}}</ref> but he came back to become Villa [[reserve team]]'s leading goalscorer as they won the 2008–09 [[Premier Reserve League]] Southern section.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.avfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10265~1664040,00.html |title=View from the dugout |publisher=Aston Villa F.C |date=21 May 2009 |accessdate=28 March 2014}}</ref> Handed a two-year contract in July 2008,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.avfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10265~1336497,00.html |title=12 new deals |publisher=Aston Villa F.C |date=1 July 2008 |accessdate=28 March 2014}}</ref> he was part of Villa's squad that won the [[2009 Peace Cup]], a pre-season tournament.<ref name=AVFCprofile/>
On 19 August 2010, Hogg made his first competitive start for Aston Villa in the 1–1 draw away to [[SK Rapid Wien|Rapid Vienna]] in the [[2010–11 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] Play-off round. Due to injuries to several other midfield players, he made his [[Premier League]] debut in the home match against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] on 13 November 2010.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_prem/9175395.stm |title=Aston Villa 2–2 Man Utd |first=Mandeep |last=Sangheera |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 November 2010 |accessdate=25 January 2011}}</ref> In December 2010, Hogg signed a new contract to tie him to the club until 2013.<ref name=Portsmouthloan/>
====Darlington (loan)==== In November 2009, Hogg joined [[Football League Two|League Two]]'s last-placed side [[Darlington F.C.|Darlington]] on [[loan (association football)|loan]] for six weeks.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.gazettelive.co.uk/north-east-sport/football/darlington-fc/2009/11/20/aston-villa-loan-star-jonathan-hogg-to-make-darlington-debut-84229-25213874/ |title=Aston Villa loan star Jonathan Hogg to make Darlington debut |first=Andrew |last=Wilkinson |newspaper=Evening Gazette |date=20 November 2009 |accessdate=20 November 2009}}</ref> He made his debut in [[the Football League]] on 21 November away to [[Chesterfield F.C.|Chesterfield]]; he played the whole game, and scored in the 87th minute to set up a close finish, but Chesterfield's [[Scott Boden]] scored twice very late in the game to make the final score 5–2.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_3/8353554.stm |title= Chesterfield 5–2 Darlington |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 November 2009 |accessdate=22 November 2009}}</ref>
====Portsmouth (loan)==== On 25 January 2011, Hogg joined [[Football League Championship|Championship]] club [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]] on loan until the end of the season.<ref name=Portsmouthloan>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/p/portsmouth/9373301.stm |title=Aston Villa's Jonathan Hogg joins Portsmouth on loan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 September 2011 |accessdate=25 September 2011}}</ref> He made his debut the same day in a 2–1 home league defeat to [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/9371582.stm |title=Portsmouth 1–2 Burnley |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 September 2011 |accessdate=25 September 2011}}</ref>
===Watford=== Hogg joined [[Football League Championship]] club [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] for an undisclosed fee on 27 August 2011, signing a three-year contract,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.watfordfc.com/page/NewsDetail/0,,10400~2433550,00.html |title=Official: Hogg signs for Hornets |accessdate=27 August 2011 |date=27 August 2011 |publisher=Watford Football Club |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120917003216/http://www.watfordfc.com/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10400~2433550%2C00.html |archivedate=17 September 2012 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.player.watfordfc.com/latest-news/article/2433550|title=Official: Hogg signs for Hornets|publisher=Watford Football Club|date=27 August 2011|accessdate=28 March 2014}}{{Subscription required}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wfcforums.com/showthread.php?39547-Jonathan-Hogg&s=d27cac2adfc97fe7cfbcdbf8148fb911&p=634254&viewfull=1#post634254|title=Reproduction of aforementioned article on WFC Forums|publisher=WFC Forums|date=27 August 2011|accessdate=28 March 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160129185751/http://www.wfcforums.com/showthread.php?39547-Jonathan-Hogg&s=d27cac2adfc97fe7cfbcdbf8148fb911&p=634254&viewfull=1#post634254|archivedate=29 January 2016}}</ref> joining his former Villa youth teammate, [[Troy Deeney]], at [[Vicarage Road]] in the process. He made his debut for Watford two days later against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]]'s arch-rivals, [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]]. Hogg finished the season having started 40 games in the league and came fourth in the [[Watford F.C. Player of the Season]] award.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.watfordfc.com/page/NewsDetail/0,,10400~2755071,00.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120502085235/http://www.watfordfc.com/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10400~2755071%2C00.html |archivedate= 2 May 2012 |title=Injury News: Relief for Hogg |accessdate=30 April 2012 |date=30 April 2012 |publisher=Watford Football Club |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
===Huddersfield Town=== Despite being a first-team regular at Watford, Hogg joined [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] on a three-year contract on 29 July 2013, motivated by family reasons to request the transfer.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.watfordfc.com/news/article/130729-hogg-joins-huddersfield-952792.aspx |title=Archived copy |accessdate=29 July 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130801013644/http://www.watfordfc.com/news/article/130729-hogg-joins-huddersfield-952792.aspx |archivedate=1 August 2013 }}</ref> He made his debut for the Terriers in their 1–0 defeat by [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] on 3 August. He scored his first goal for the club in the 3–2 win over [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]] in the [[Football League Cup]] on 27 August 2013.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23764062 |title=Huddersfield 3–2 Charlton |publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |date=27 August 2013 |accessdate=20 January 2016}}</ref> His first league goal for the Terriers came in their 2–1 win over [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] on 20 August 2016, his first league goal in 7 years.
For the 2016–17 season, Huddersfield Town gained promotion to the [[Premier League|English Premier League]] for the first time. Hogg was voted by his team mates the "Player's Player of the Year"<ref>{{cite web|title=Jonathan Hogg Named Player of the Season|url=http://www.jamesgrant.com/blog/jonathan-hogg-named-huddersfield-towns-players-player-year/|publisher= James Grant.com|accessdate=11 March 2018}}</ref> During that season Hogg suffered in a collision with a team mate and taken to hospital after a defeat away at [[Bristol City]] on 17 March 2017. He was initially ruled out for the remainder of the season after fears that he had fractured his neck. However after further scans, he was allowed to return less than a month later on 5 April for a victory against [[Norwich City]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Jonathan Hogg: Huddersfield Town midfielder 'feared the worst' after neck injury|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39515083|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=11 March 2018}}</ref>
On 9 August 2017, manager [[David Wagner (footballer)|David Wagner]] appointed [[Tommy Smith (footballer, born 1992)|Tommy Smith]] as the [[captain (association football)|club captain]] with Hogg and German defender [[Christopher Schindler]] as [[vice-captain (association football)|his deputies]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Tommy Smith announced new club captain|url=https://www.htafc.com/news/2017/august/tommy-smith-named-new-club-captain/|publisher=Huddersfield Town|accessdate=17 October 2017}}</ref> During his 5 seasons at Huddersfield this tough tackling centre midfielder has become a crowd favourite making over 150 League and Cup appearances for the club.
